Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which humans stop moving into a certain direction and start moving back into the direction they came from
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
literally: to sit on a throne; hence: = action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ symbolized by taking position on the seat that represents this position of authority
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= causative action by which deities or humans ensure that (other) humans and/or their actions will no longer be remembered
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to judge|to pass judgment|to vindicate|to rule
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: (God as a) stronghold|(God as a) refuge
Node.definition: = a reference to God characterizing him as someone who provides security
literally: crushed; hence: = state in which someone is the victim of suffering and humiliation ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object

Node.gloss: (God as a) stronghold|(God as a) refuge
Node.definition: = a reference to God characterizing him as someone who provides security
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= an activity performed by a person or deity
= causative action by which deities hold humans accountable for some event and demand satisfaction
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to raise (someone) up from the gates of death; hence: = causative action by which deities keep humans from dying
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= a deed that merits appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= action by which humans or deities reveal information about themselves to (other) humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans play musical instruments with reduced intensity
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities show that they are powerful
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= stat in which humans or animals experience fear|read מֹורָא (מֹורָא)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
